There are beautiful cities like Minas Tirith in LotR, cities in the treetops in a number of stories by various authors, cities that float among the clouds, cities beneath the sea, or floating atop the sea, or in caverns beneath the earth, such as Gondolin or Moria.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"unordered-list\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"Rural settings: \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"italic\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"Many stories begin in an innocent land of farms and small villages, from which untried and naive heroes set off on a quest. Author Harry Turtledove specializes in stories in which the results of certain battles came out differently. L. Sprague DeCamp had one in which one person travels back in time to ancient Rome and totally changes everything using his knowledge from the future. My favorite series of AH had two changes: in the early Middle Ages the Laws of Magic were discovered, and science became nothing more than a hobby. And Richard Lionheart didn't die, but founded a huge Empire that was still strong, even into the 20th century.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": [{\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"What are the different types of fantasy settings in writing?\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", [{\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"Fantasy settings in writing can vary widely, offering rich and imaginative worlds for readers to explore. Here are some common types of fantasy settings:\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"1. **Medieval Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Often inspired by medieval Europe, this setting features castles, knights, dragons, and magical elements. It's a classic backdrop for epic quests and tales of chivalry.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"2. **Urban Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Set in contemporary or modern cities with a magical or supernatural twist. The magical elements coexist with everyday life, and protagonists navigate both the mundane and magical aspects of the world.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"3. **High Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Characterized by grand and immersive world-building, high fantasy often involves complex histories, multiple races, and intricate magical systems. J.R.R. Tolkien's Middle-earth is a quintessential example.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"4. **Low Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Takes place in a world similar to our own but with added fantastical elements. The magical aspects are often subtle, and the focus may be more on characters and their personal struggles.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"5. **Steampunk:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Blends fantasy with technology, often set in a Victorian-era-inspired world where steam-powered machinery and advanced technology coexist with magic.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"6. **Sword and Sorcery:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Emphasizes action, adventure, and individual heroics. Characters often wield swords and practice sorcery in a world filled with monsters and magical threats.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"7. **Epic Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Features vast, epic narratives with intricate plots, multiple characters, and overarching conflicts. The fate of entire worlds or civilizations may be at stake.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"8. **Magical Realism:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Grounded in a realistic setting but with magical elements seamlessly integrated into the narrative. The magical aspects are often accepted as a natural part of the world.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"9. **Dystopian Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Set in a world where society has crumbled, and often dark or oppressive forces rule. Magic may play a role in resistance or survival.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"10. **Fairy Tale Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Draws inspiration from traditional fairy tales, featuring magical creatures, enchanted forests, and quests with a fairy tale structure.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"11. **Science Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Blurs the lines between science fiction and fantasy, incorporating both futuristic technology and magical or supernatural elements.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"12. **Historical Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Places magical elements within a historical context, merging real historical events with fantasy elements. It often explores what might have happened if magic existed in the past.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"13. **Space Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Transposes fantasy elements into a space setting, combining magical elements with space exploration and interstellar adventures.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, Often explores themes of social commentary and the nature of reality.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"unordered-list\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"Examples:\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"bold\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\" Neil Gaiman's \\\\\\\"Neverwhere,\\\\\\\" Charles Stross's \\\\\\\"Laundry Files\\\\\\\" series, Ben Aaronovitch's \\\\\\\"Rivers of London\\\\\\\" series.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"unordered-list\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"Portal Fantasy:\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"bold\\\": true}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"Characteristics:\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"bold\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\" Characters travel from the real world to a fantastical realm, often through a magical portal or object. The focus is on the character's journey of discovery and adaptation in this new world.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"unordered-list\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"Examples:\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"bold\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\" C.S. [{\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"Well, the answer for \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"most\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"italic\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\" of the settings in fantasy are exactly like the settings in the real world. And some are set in an AU/AH version of our own world.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"In the rest of fantasies it usually is those same settings, but altered in some way, such as size, color, density or location.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"Why the similarities? Because the readers need an identifiable anchor to help them understand what is going on.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"World: \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"italic\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"Most are generally round like our Earth, but some have more than one moon or sun. There are flat worlds, like Pratchett's \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"Discworld, \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"italic\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"or worlds that were flat and turned round, like Tolkien's Arda (maybe, since he might have changed his mind on that) or a world in which it is the only world in its galaxy. Or whatever your imagination can come up with.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"ordered-list\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"Cities: \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"italic\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"There are seedy are cities that are full of thieves and corruption, like Fritz Leiber\\\\u2019s Lankhmar, or Pratchett's Ankh-Morpok. There are beautiful cities like Minas Tirith in LotR, cities in the treetops in a number of stories by various authors, cities that float among the clouds, cities beneath the sea, or floating atop the sea, or in caverns beneath the earth, such as Gondolin or Moria.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"unordered-list\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"Rural settings: \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"italic\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"Many stories begin in an innocent land of farms and small villages, from which untried and naive heroes set off on a quest. These begin with the most famous, Tolkien's Shire, but many others follow.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"unordered-list\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"Mountains: \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"italic\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"Rugged and dangerous, not often the main setting, but very often a place filled with obstacles to overcome.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"unordered-list\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"Jungles\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"italic\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\": See mountains above.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"unordered-list\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"Those are all settings that have been used for fantasists in their world-building if they are starting a world from scratch.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"If you want to use our own world, but with magic that takes us into AU/AH territory.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"AU: \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"italic\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"A universe in which the supernatural exists, but people are mostly oblivious to it. \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"Harry Potter \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"italic\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"and \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"Harry Dresden \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"italic\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"are both examples of this. A number of TV and movie fantasies follow this path: \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Charmed, Bewitched, I Dream of Genie, \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"italic\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"and many more.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"unordered-list\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"AH: \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"italic\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"This is a setting in which a key point (s) in our world has been altered, which in turn ends up causing a ripple effect which in turn causes a vastly different world than we know. Author Harry Turtledove specializes in stories in which the results of certain battles came out differently. L. Sprague DeCamp had one in which one person travels back in time to ancient Rome and totally changes everything using his knowledge from the future. My favorite series of AH had two changes: in the early Middle Ages the Laws of Magic were discovered, and science became nothing more than a hobby. And Richard Lionheart didn't die, but founded a huge Empire that was still strong, even into the 20th century.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"unordered-list\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"I am sure that there are even more ways to create amazing setting beyond these.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], Noss\",\"familyName\":\"\",\"scriptCode\":\"LATN\"}],\"adminNames\":[],\"profileUrl\":\"https://www.quora.com/profile/H-Noss\"}],\"isCommentsDisabled\":false,\"isCollapsedForViewer\":false,\"isModerationLocked\":false,\"moderationCollapseTypeUrl\":null,\"network\":{\"id\":\"TmV0d29yazow\",\"__typename\":\"Network\",\"contentLanguageCode\":\"en\",\"appealsFormUrl\":\"https://help.quora.com/hc/en/requests/new?ticket_form_id=198746\"},\"collapseOperation\":null,\"numDisplayComments\":0,\"__isReportable\":\"Answer\",\"reportableId\":1477743724339181,\"canViewerReport\":false,\"viewerVoteType\":\"novote\",\"__isCommentable\":\"Answer\",\"feedPreviewComment\":null}},\"cursor\":\"3\"},{\"id\":\"UXVlc3Rpb25QYWdlZExpc3RFZGdlOjQ=\",\"__typename\":\"QuestionPagedListEdge\",\"node\":{\"id\":\"UXVlc3Rpb25BbnN3ZXJJdGVtMkAwOjE3NjI5MDQ3MTphbnN3ZXI6MTQ3Nzc0MzcyODg4NDcwMA==\",\"__typename\":\"QuestionAnswerItem2\",\"__isQuestionPagedListItem\":\"QuestionAnswerItem2\",\"question\":{\"qid\":176290471,\"id\":\"UXVlc3Rpb25AMDoxNzYyOTA0NzE=\",\"title\":\"{\\\"sections\\\": [{\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"What are the different types of fantasy settings in writing?\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}]}\"},\"displayReason\":null,\"index\":2,\"answer\":{\"aid\":1477743728884700,\"id\":\"QW5zd2VyQDA6MTQ3Nzc0MzcyODg4NDcwMA==\",\"isDeleted\":false,\"isMachineAnswer\":false,\"content\":\"{\\\"sections\\\": [{\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"Fantasy settings in writing can vary widely, offering rich and imaginative worlds for readers to explore. Here are some common types of fantasy settings:\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"1. **Medieval Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Often inspired by medieval Europe, this setting features castles, knights, dragons, and magical elements. It's a classic backdrop for epic quests and tales of chivalry.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"2. **Urban Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Set in contemporary or modern cities with a magical or supernatural twist. The magical elements coexist with everyday life, and protagonists navigate both the mundane and magical aspects of the world.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"3. **High Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Characterized by grand and immersive world-building, high fantasy often involves complex histories, multiple races, and intricate magical systems. J.R.R. Tolkien's Middle-earth is a quintessential example.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"4. **Low Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Takes place in a world similar to our own but with added fantastical elements. The magical aspects are often subtle, and the focus may be more on characters and their personal struggles.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"5. **Steampunk:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Blends fantasy with technology, often set in a Victorian-era-inspired world where steam-powered machinery and advanced technology coexist with magic.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"6. **Sword and Sorcery:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Emphasizes action, adventure, and individual heroics. Characters often wield swords and practice sorcery in a world filled with monsters and magical threats.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"7. **Epic Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Features vast, epic narratives with intricate plots, multiple characters, and overarching conflicts. The fate of entire worlds or civilizations may be at stake.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"8. **Magical Realism:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Grounded in a realistic setting but with magical elements seamlessly integrated into the narrative. The magical aspects are often accepted as a natural part of the world.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"9. **Dystopian Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Set in a world where society has crumbled, and often dark or oppressive forces rule. Magic may play a role in resistance or survival.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"10. **Fairy Tale Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Draws inspiration from traditional fairy tales, featuring magical creatures, enchanted forests, and quests with a fairy tale structure.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"11. **Science Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Blurs the lines between science fiction and fantasy, incorporating both futuristic technology and magical or supernatural elements.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"12. **Historical Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Places magical elements within a historical context, merging real historical events with fantasy elements. It often explores what might have happened if magic existed in the past.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"13. **Space Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Transposes fantasy elements into a space setting, combining magical elements with space exploration and interstellar adventures.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"Each type of fantasy setting offers unique storytelling opportunities, and authors often There are beautiful cities like Minas Tirith in LotR, cities in the treetops in a number of stories by various authors, cities that float among the clouds, cities beneath the sea, or floating atop the sea, or in caverns beneath the earth, such as Gondolin or Moria.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"unordered-list\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"Rural settings: \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"italic\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"Many stories begin in an innocent land of farms and small villages, from which untried and naive heroes set off on a quest. These begin with the most famous, Tolkien's Shire, but many others follow.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"unordered-list\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"Mountains: \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"italic\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"Rugged and dangerous, not often the main setting, but very often a place filled with obstacles to overcome.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"unordered-list\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"Jungles\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"italic\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\": See mountains above.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"unordered-list\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"Those are all settings that have been used for fantasists in their world-building if they are starting a world from scratch.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"If you want to use our own world, but with magic that takes us into AU/AH territory.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"AU: \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"italic\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"A universe in which the supernatural exists, but people are mostly oblivious to it. \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"Harry Potter \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"italic\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"and \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"Harry Dresden \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"italic\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"are both examples of this. A number of TV and movie fantasies follow this path: \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Charmed, Bewitched, I Dream of Genie, \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"italic\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"and many more.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"unordered-list\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"AH: \\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {\\\"italic\\\": true}}, {\\\"text\\\": \\\"This is a setting in which a key point (s) in our world has been altered, which in turn ends up causing a ripple effect which in turn causes a vastly different world than we know. Author Harry Turtledove specializes in stories in which the results of certain battles came out differently. L. Sprague DeCamp had one in which one person travels back in time to ancient Rome and totally changes everything using his knowledge from the future. My favorite series of AH had two changes: in the early Middle Ages the Laws of Magic were discovered, and science became nothing more than a hobby. And Richard Lionheart didn't die, but founded a huge Empire that was still strong, even into the 20th century.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": [{\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"What are the different types of fantasy settings in writing?\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", [{\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"Fantasy settings in writing can vary widely, offering rich and imaginative worlds for readers to explore. Here are some common types of fantasy settings:\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"1. **Medieval Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Often inspired by medieval Europe, this setting features castles, knights, dragons, and magical elements. It's a classic backdrop for epic quests and tales of chivalry.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"2. **Urban Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Set in contemporary or modern cities with a magical or supernatural twist. The magical elements coexist with everyday life, and protagonists navigate both the mundane and magical aspects of the world.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"3. **High Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Characterized by grand and immersive world-building, high fantasy often involves complex histories, multiple races, and intricate magical systems. J.R.R. Tolkien's Middle-earth is a quintessential example.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"4. **Low Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Takes place in a world similar to our own but with added fantastical elements. The magical aspects are often subtle, and the focus may be more on characters and their personal struggles.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"5. **Steampunk:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Blends fantasy with technology, often set in a Victorian-era-inspired world where steam-powered machinery and advanced technology coexist with magic.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"6. **Sword and Sorcery:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Emphasizes action, adventure, and individual heroics. Characters often wield swords and practice sorcery in a world filled with monsters and magical threats.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"7. **Epic Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Features vast, epic narratives with intricate plots, multiple characters, and overarching conflicts. The fate of entire worlds or civilizations may be at stake.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"8. **Magical Realism:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Grounded in a realistic setting but with magical elements seamlessly integrated into the narrative. The magical aspects are often accepted as a natural part of the world.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"9. **Dystopian Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Set in a world where society has crumbled, and often dark or oppressive forces rule. Magic may play a role in resistance or survival.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"10. **Fairy Tale Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Draws inspiration from traditional fairy tales, featuring magical creatures, enchanted forests, and quests with a fairy tale structure.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"11. **Science Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Blurs the lines between science fiction and fantasy, incorporating both futuristic technology and magical or supernatural elements.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"12. **Historical Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Places magical elements within a historical context, merging real historical events with fantasy elements. It often explores what might have happened if magic existed in the past.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"13. **Space Fantasy:**\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"- Transposes fantasy elements into a space setting, combining magical elements with space exploration and interstellar adventures.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": false}, {\\\"spans\\\": [{\\\"text\\\": \\\"Each type of fantasy setting offers unique storytelling opportunities, and authors often blend elements from multiple sub-genres to create rich and diverse fantasy worlds.\\\", \\\"modifiers\\\": {}}], \\\"indent\\\": 0, \\\"quoted\\\": false, \\\"type\\\": \\\"plain\\\", \\\"is_rtl\\\": document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", (event) => {
	let infoBannerId=document.getElementById('rich-text-39056285-933b-4c4c-87e8-29bdbecb5f90');
	if (infoBannerId) 
	{
		document.body.classList.add('has-info-banner');
		addEventListener("scroll", (event) => { 
			if (window.scrollY>50) document.body.classList.remove('has-info-banner'); 
			else document.body.classList.add('has-info-banner');
		});
	}

	if (inJournalScope())
		initJournalDfp();
	else if (inMicrositeScope()) 
		initMicrositeDfp();
	else 
		initGlobalDfp();
});

<script defer src="https://static.cloudflareinsights.com/beacon.min.js/v84a3a4012de94ce1a686ba8c167c359c1696973893317" integrity="sha512-euoFGowhlaLqXsPWQ48qSkBSCFs3DPRyiwVu3FjR96cMPx+Fr+gpWRhIafcHwqwCqWS42RZhIudOvEI+Ckf6MA==" data-cf-beacon='{"rayId":"862d15dd58e0eeb8","version":"2024.2.4","token":"fa0710f1386f47618f0d7685b0e0d4a3"}' crossorigin="anonymous" nonce="9b8dff5c6ea9d13a-SJC"></script>




<!-- loading Javascript for using the persistence Service -->
    <script src="/wro/d6ea3c9cf483d863939617799673519f96fad177~thiss-ds.js" async nonce="9b8dff5c6ea9d13a-SJC"></script>

    <script type="text/javascript" nonce="9b8dff5c6ea9d13a-SJC">

        var SeamlessAccessService = {
            spUrl: "/action/ssostart",
            


    
        returnURL: "/doi/abs/10.1177/02762366211019782",
    
    


            my_context: 'seamlessaccess.org',
            timeout: 5000,
            _persistenceService: null,
            _getPersistenceService: function () {
                if (!this._persistenceService) {
                    this._persistenceService = new thiss.PersistenceService('https://service.seamlessaccess.org/ps/');
                }
                return this._persistenceService;
            },

            getWAYFLessUrl: function (entityId) {
                return this.spUrl + "?idp=" + encodeURIComponent(entityId)
                    + "&redirectUri=" + encodeURIComponent(this.returnURL);
            },
            retrieveEntity: function (ms) {
                var self = this;
                var persistService = this._getPersistenceService();

                if (ms == undefined || ms === '') {
                    ms = this.timeout;
                }

                return new Promise(function (resolve, reject) {
                    persistService.entities(self.my_context)
                        .then(function (res) {
                            return resolve(res.data);
                        }, function (err) {
                            // failed
                            reject('failed to retrieve entity from local storage: ' + err);
                        });
                    // Set up the timeout
                    setTimeout(function () {
                        reject('Promise timed out ' + ms + ' ms');
                    }, ms);
                });
            },
            updateEntity: function (entitydata) {
                var self = this;
                var persistService = this._getPersistenceService();

                var jsonObj = {};
                try {
                    //try to parse it, if it is a json string
                    jsonObj = JSON.parse(entitydata.val());
                } catch (e) {
                    jsonObj = entitydata;
                }
                return new Promise(function (resolve, reject) {
                    persistService.update(self.my_context, jsonObj)
                        .then(function (res) {
                            // Process the results
                            var ssoInstitutions = res.data;
                            return resolve(ssoInstitutions);
                        }, function (err) {
                            // failed
                            console.log('failed to update the local storage due to: ' + err);
                            reject(err);
                        });
                })
            },
            removeEntity: function (entityId) {
                var self = this;
                var persistService = this._getPersistenceService();

                return new Promise(function (resolve) {
                    persistService.remove(self.my_context, entityId)
                        .then(function (res) {
                            return resolve(res);
                        }, function (err) {
                            // failed
                            console.log('failed to remove from local storage duo to: ' + err);
                        });
                })
            },
            getAccessibleEntityStatus: function (doi, entityId, entityTitle) {
                return new Promise(function (resolve, reject) {
                    $.ajax({
                        type: 'POST',
                        url: '/action/seamlessAccess',
                        accept: {
                            text: "application/json"
                        },
                        data: {
                            doi: doi,
                            entityid: entityId,
                            entityTitle: entityTitle,
                            eventGroupKey: 'c83af456-18c5-488e-aa8f-b69202a224bb'
                        }

                    }).done(function (status) {
                        return resolve(status);
                    }).fail(function (status) {
                        return reject(status);
                    });
                });
            },
            getEntitiesWithAllInfo: function (doi) {
                let self = this,
                    arrayOfPromises = [];
                return new Promise(function (resolve, reject) {
                    self.retrieveEntity().then(function (res) {
                        let allSsoInstitutions = res;
                        for (i = 0; i < allSsoInstitutions.length; i++) {
                            let ssoInstitution = allSsoInstitutions[i];
                            arrayOfPromises.push(new Promise(function (resolve) {
                                self.getAccessibleEntityStatus(doi, ssoInstitution.entity.entityID, ssoInstitution.entity.title)
                                    .then(function (entityStatus) {
                                        resolve({
                                            entityID: ssoInstitution.entity.entityID,
                                            entityTitle: ssoInstitution.entity.title,
                                            entityStatusObj: entityStatus,
                                            entitySsoUrl: self.getWAYFLessUrl(ssoInstitution.entity.entityID)
                                        });
                                    }, function (err) {
                                        console.log('failed to get the entity status: ' + ssoInstitution.entity.entityID,err);
                                    });
                            }));
                        }
                        if(allSsoInstitutions.length === 0 && false){
                            self.getAccessibleEntityStatus(doi, null, null)
                                .then(function () {
                                    console.log('No Entity found');
                                }, function (err) {
                                    console.log('failed to get the none entity status' ,err);
                                });
                        }
                        Promise.all(arrayOfPromises)
                            .then(function (finalResponse) {
                                resolve(finalResponse);
                            }).catch(function (err) {
                                reject(err);
                            });

                    }).catch(function (err) {
                        reject(err);
                    })
                });
            }
        };

        window.addEventListener('load', function () {
            document.querySelectorAll(".sso-institution").forEach(function (institution) {
                var entityId = institution.getAttribute('data-entityid');
                var entityName = institution.getAttribute('data-name');
                var entitydata = {
                    entityID: entityId,
                    title: entityName
                };
                institution.addEventListener("click", function (e) {
                    e.preventDefault();

                    if ($('.institution-preference-userconsent-checkbox').length > 0) {
                        let institutionPreferenceUserConsentCheckbox = $('.institution-preference-userconsent-checkbox').get(0);
                        if (!$(institutionPreferenceUserConsentCheckbox).is(":checked")) {
                            return;
                        }
                    }

                    var self = this;
                    SeamlessAccessService.updateEntity(entitydata).then(function (res) {
                        console.log(res);
                        window.location.href = self.href;
                    }).catch(function (err) {
                        window.location.href = self.href;
                    });
                });
            });
        });

    </script>

    <script src="//scholar.google.com/scholar_js/casa.js" async nonce="9b8dff5c6ea9d13a-SJC"></script>

        </head>

        <div data-widget-def="UX3Banner" data-widget-id="c9ae5b6e-d03a-4615-80b8-2dfab86523c4" class="banner-widget--article-page">
        <section style="background-image: url('/pb-assets/Headers/spICA_header-1662986020010.jpg');" class="banner-widget  banner-widget--main-content"><div class="container banner-widget__container"><div class="row banner-widget__content banner-widget__content-main"><div class="col-12">

href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#6c0e1e050d021e19090805020b091e2c0b010d0500420f0301" property="email" aria-label="Email address"><span class="__cf_email__" id="abstracts" data-extent="frontmatter"><div class="core-container"><section id="abstract" property="abstract" typeof="Text" role="doc-abstract"><h2 property="name">Abstract</h2><div role="paragraph">Research suggests individuals import real-world facts into fictional worlds based on the type of fact and fictional context. We examined the importation of real-world morality across fictional contexts. Undergraduate (Study 1) and MTurk (Study 2) participants were randomly assigned to read either a realistic or matching fantastical interactive narrative. At seven junctions, participants were presented with a choice between behaving morally and behaving immorally to advance their goals. In Study 3, an MTurk sample judged the actions of a character who behaved immorally. For Study 1, a gender by condition interaction was found, with males electing more immoral actions in the fantasy condition. For Study 2, no such effect was found. Nonetheless, in Study 3, participants judged immoral actions in the realistic condition as more immoral compared to the fantasy context. Across all studies, transportation predicted choosing fewer immoral actions and judging immoral actions more harshly.</div></section></div></div><section id="bodymatter" data-extent="bodymatter" property="articleBody" typeof="Text"><div class="core-container"><section aria-labelledby="denial-block-title" class="denial-block "><i class="icon-lock-alt d-lg-none"><span class="path1"></span><span class="path2"></span><span class="path3"></span><span class="path4"></span></i><h2 id="denial-block-title" class="denial-block__title">Get full access to this article</h2><p class="denial-block__text">View all access and purchase options for this article.</p><div class="denial-block__cta"><a href="#core-collateral-purchase-access" class="btn btn-primary"><span>Get Access</span><i aria-hidden="true" class="icon-lock_closed_not_fill"></i></a></div></section></div></section><section id="backmatter" data-extent="backmatter"><div class="core-container"><section id="bibliography" role="doc-bibliography"><h2>References</h2><div role="list"><div role="listitem"><div id="bibr1-02762366211019782" class="citations"><div class="citation"><div class="citation-content">Aquino K., Reed I. Luton, UK: Luton University Press.</div><div class="external-links"><div class="core-xlink-google-scholar"><a href="https://scholar.google.com/scholar_lookup?title=Basal+morality+in+drama+appreciation.+In+I.+Bondebjerg+%28Ed.%29%2C+Moving+images%2C+culture%2C+and+the+mind+%281st+ed.%2C+Vol.+1%2C+pp.+53%E2%80%9363%29.+Luton%2C+UK%3A+Luton+University+Press.&amp;author=D.+Zillmann&amp;publication_year=2000">Google Scholar</a></div></div></div></div></div></div></section><section id="biographies" class="core-biographies"><h2>Biographies</h2><div class="core-biography"><div role="paragraph"><b>Brian Ruedinger</b> is a PhD candidate in the Department of Psychology at the University of Oklahoma.</div><div role="paragraph"><b>Jennifer Barnes</b> is an Associate Professor of Psychology and Professional Writing at the University of Oklahoma. In addition to studying the cognitive science of fiction and imagination, she is also a New York Times bestselling novelist. Her research focuses on the impacts of engaging with fiction, the limits of the imagination, and the psychology of fandom.</div></div></section><section id="supplementary-materials" class="core-supplementary-materials"><h2>Supplementary Material</h2><p>Please find the following supplemental material available below.</p><p>For Open Access articles published under a <a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/">Creative Commons License</a>, all supplemental material carries the same license as the article it is associated with.</p><p>For non-Open Access articles published, all supplemental material carries a non-exclusive license, and permission requests for re-use of supplemental material or any part of supplemental material shall be sent directly to the copyright owner as specified in the copyright notice associated with the article.</p><div role="list"><div class="core-supplementary-material" role="listitem"><div class="core-link"><ul><li><a href="/doi/suppl/10.1177/02762366211019782/suppl_file/sj-pdf-1-ica-10.1177_02762366211019782.pdf" download="sj-pdf-1-ica-10.1177_02762366211019782.pdf"><i class="icon-download-outline" aria-hidden="true"></i><span class="core-filename">sj-pdf-1-ica-10.1177_02762366211019782.pdf</span></a></li><li>1.35 MB</li></ul></div></div></div></section></div></section></div><div class="core-collateral" role="dialog" aria-modal="true"><div id="core-collateral-self-citation" aria-expanded="false"><header><h2><i class="icon-cite" aria-hidden="true"></i>Cite</h2></header><h3>Cite</h3><div class="section--wrapper"><section>

                reason: '',

                    this.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];

                        if ($('#ad-blocker-test-image').is(':visible')) {
                            this.adBlockerPresent = false;
                        }

                        }
                    }
                    else {
                        this.reason = '(script block)';
                    }
                    console.log('Blocking Ads: ' + (this.adBlockerPresent ? 'Yes ' : 'No ') + this.reason);

                    if (index !== -1) {
                        dataLayer[index].site.ad_blocker = this.adBlockerPresent
                    }
                    window.dataLayer = this.dataLayer;
                }
            }
            adBlockerTracker.run();
        }
    }

document.addEventListener("DOMContentLoaded", (event) => {
	let infoBannerId=document.getElementById('rich-text-39056285-933b-4c4c-87e8-29bdbecb5f90');
	if (infoBannerId) 
	{
		document.body.classList.add('has-info-banner');
		addEventListener("scroll", (event) => { 
			if (window.scrollY>50) document.body.classList.remove('has-info-banner'); 
			else document.body.classList.add('has-info-banner');
		});
	}

	if (inJournalScope())
		initJournalDfp();
	else if (inMicrositeScope()) 
		initMicrositeDfp();
	else 
		initGlobalDfp();
});

    <script type="text/javascript" nonce="9b8e1d3e5c369e8a-SJC">

        var SeamlessAccessService = {
            spUrl: "/action/ssostart",
            


    
        returnURL: "/doi/abs/10.1177/02762366211019782",
    
    


            my_context: 'seamlessaccess.org',
            timeout: 5000,
            _persistenceService: null,
            _getPersistenceService: function () {
                if (!this._persistenceService) {
                    this._persistenceService = new thiss.PersistenceService('https://service.seamlessaccess.org/ps/');
                }
                return this._persistenceService;
            },

            getWAYFLessUrl: function (entityId) {
                return this.spUrl + "?idp=" + encodeURIComponent(entityId)
                    + "&redirectUri=" + encodeURIComponent(this.returnURL);
            },
            retrieveEntity: function (ms) {
                var self = this;
                var persistService = this._getPersistenceService();

                if (ms == undefined || ms === '') {
                    ms = this.timeout;
                }

                return new Promise(function (resolve, reject) {
                    persistService.entities(self.my_context)
                        .then(function (res) {
                            return resolve(res.data);
                        }, function (err) {
                            // failed
                            reject('failed to retrieve entity from local storage: ' + err);
                        });
                    // Set up the timeout
                    setTimeout(function () {
                        reject('Promise timed out ' + ms + ' ms');
                    }, ms);
                });
            },
            updateEntity: function (entitydata) {
                var self = this;
                var persistService = this._getPersistenceService();

                var jsonObj = {};
                try {
                    //try to parse it, if it is a json string
                    jsonObj = JSON.parse(entitydata.val());
                } catch (e) {
                    jsonObj = entitydata;
                }
                return new Promise(function (resolve, reject) {
                    persistService.update(self.my_context, jsonObj)
                        .then(function (res) {
                            // Process the results
                            var ssoInstitutions = res.data;
                            return resolve(ssoInstitutions);
                        }, function (err) {
                            // failed
                            console.log('failed to update the local storage due to: ' + err);
                            reject(err);
                        });
                })
            },
            removeEntity: function (entityId) {
                var self = this;
                var persistService = this._getPersistenceService();

                return new Promise(function (resolve) {
                    persistService.remove(self.my_context, entityId)
                        .then(function (res) {
                            return resolve(res);
                        }, function (err) {
                            // failed
                            console.log('failed to remove from local storage duo to: ' + err);
                        });
                })
            },
            getAccessibleEntityStatus: function (doi, entityId, entityTitle) {
                return new Promise(function (resolve, reject) {
                    $.ajax({
                        type: 'POST',
                        url: '/action/seamlessAccess',
                        accept: {
                            text: "application/json"
                        },
                        data: {
                            doi: doi,
                            entityid: entityId,
                            entityTitle: entityTitle,
                            eventGroupKey: 'a13ec43c-45ed-4f1d-ad95-a8cc6cc9b1f0'
                        }

                    }).done(function (status) {
                        return resolve(status);
                    }).fail(function (status) {
                        return reject(status);
                    });
                });
            },
            getEntitiesWithAllInfo: function (doi) {
                let self = this,
                    arrayOfPromises = [];
                return new Promise(function (resolve, reject) {
                    self.retrieveEntity().then(function (res) {
                        let allSsoInstitutions = res;
                        for (i = 0; i < allSsoInstitutions.length; i++) {
                            let ssoInstitution = allSsoInstitutions[i];
                            arrayOfPromises.push(new Promise(function (resolve) {
                                self.getAccessibleEntityStatus(doi, ssoInstitution.entity.entityID, ssoInstitution.entity.title)
                                    .then(function (entityStatus) {
                                        resolve({
                                            entityID: ssoInstitution.entity.entityID,
                                            entityTitle: ssoInstitution.entity.title,
                                            entityStatusObj: entityStatus,
                                            entitySsoUrl: self.getWAYFLessUrl(ssoInstitution.entity.entityID)
                                        });
                                    }, function (err) {
                                        console.log('failed to get the entity status: ' + ssoInstitution.entity.entityID,err);
                                    });
                            }));
                        }
                        if(allSsoInstitutions.length === 0 && false){
                            self.getAccessibleEntityStatus(doi, null, null)
                                .then(function () {
                                    console.log('No Entity found');
                                }, function (err) {
                                    console.log('failed to get the none entity status' ,err);
                                });
                        }
                        Promise.all(arrayOfPromises)
                            .then(function (finalResponse) {
                                resolve(finalResponse);
                            }).catch(function (err) {
                                reject(err);
                            });

                    }).catch(function (err) {
                        reject(err);
                    })
                });
            }
        };

        window.addEventListener('load', function () {
            document.querySelectorAll(".sso-institution").forEach(function (institution) {
                var entityId = institution.getAttribute('data-entityid');
                var entityName = institution.getAttribute('data-name');
                var entitydata = {
                    entityID: entityId,
                    title: entityName
                };
                institution.addEventListener("click", function (e) {
                    e.preventDefault();

                    if ($('.institution-preference-userconsent-checkbox').length > 0) {
                        let institutionPreferenceUserConsentCheckbox = $('.institution-preference-userconsent-checkbox').get(0);
                        if (!$(institutionPreferenceUserConsentCheckbox).is(":checked")) {
                            return;
                        }
                    }

                    var self = this;
                    SeamlessAccessService.updateEntity(entitydata).then(function (res) {
                        console.log(res);
                        window.location.href = self.href;
                    }).catch(function (err) {
                        window.location.href = self.href;
                    });
                });
            });
        });

    </script>

    <script src="//scholar.google.com/scholar_js/casa.js" async nonce="9b8e1d3e5c369e8a-SJC"></script>

        </head>

        <div data-widget-def="eCommerceCartIndicatorWidget" data-widget-id="05e0aa7c-df3d-4312-a5f7-7f9e528398ef" class="eCommerceCartIndicatorWidget">

        <div data-mv="The main menu" class="main-nav"><a href="#main1" rel="nofollow" data-target="main1" data-toggle="nav" class="main-nav__toggle__controller"><img src="/specs/products/sage/releasedAssets/images/hamburger-menu-11ca83bae8b819f1d6c46b5bbddcf530.svg" aria-hidden="true" width="19" height="19" class="main-menu__toggle"/><img src="/specs/products/sage/releasedAssets/images/close-a351a693d1ede9b5b4a494ad74053c83.svg" aria-hidden="true" class="main-menu__toggle-close"/><span class="sr-only close">Close Drawer Menu</span><span class="sr-only open">Open Drawer Menu</span><span class="label">Menu</span></a><nav role="navigation" id="main1" data-ctrl-res="screen-md" aria-label="Browse and Info" class="drawer__nav hidden-md hidden-sm hidden-xs"><ul id="menubar" role="menubar" class="menubar rlist--inline"><li role="menuitem" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="true" tabIndex="0" aria-label="Browse by discipline" id="menu-item-main1-0" class="dropdown menu-parent"><button type="button" id="main1-1" data-id="global-header-browse-menu" data-toggle="modal" data-target="#main1-modal-1" aria-expanded="false" aria-controls="main1-dropdown-1" aria-haspopup="true" data-backdrop="false" tabIndex="-1" class="dropdown-toggle"><span>Browse by discipline</span><i aria-hidden="true" class="icon-arrow_down pull-right"></i></button><div class="ux-modal-container"><div id="main1-modal-1" class="modal"><div aria-label="Journal Categories" class="modal-dialog modal__dialog menu-item"><div class="modal__body">

        <link id="build-style-article" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" href="/products/sage/releasedAssets/css/build-article-7aa09c1ec5cab9bd6315.css"/><article xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" data-design="pill-menubar" data-has="right-rail" data-type="research-article" vocab="http://schema.org/" typeof="ScholarlyArticle" lang="en" dir="ltr"><header data-extent="frontmatter" role="region" aria-label="Article information"><div class="core-container"><div data-article-access="no" data-article-access-type="other" class="meta-panel"><div class="meta-panel__left-content"><div class="meta-panel__access meta-panel__access--other"><i aria-hidden="true" title="Restricted access" class="icon-locked-grey"><span class="path1"></span><span class="path2"></span><span class="path3"></span></i><span>Restricted access</span></div><div class="meta-panel__type"><span>Research article</span></div><div class="meta-panel__onlineDate">First published online June 2, 2021</div><div class="meta-panel__permissions"><a href="https://s100.copyright.com/AppDispatchServlet?publisherName=sage&amp;publication=j770&amp;title=The+Effect+of+Fantasy+Context+on+Moral+Action+and+Judgment&amp;publicationDate=2022-03-01&amp;author=Brian+Ruedinger%2C+Jennifer+Barnes&amp;contentID=10.1177%2F02762366211019782&amp;volumeNum=41&amp;issueNum=3&amp;startPage=245&amp;endPage=273&amp;numPages=29&amp;orderBeanReset=true" target="_blank" data-id="article-metadata-rightslink"><span>   Request permissions</span><i aria-hidden="true" class="icon-external-link"></i></a></div></div><div class="meta-panel__right-content"></div></div><h1 property="name">The Effect of Fantasy Context on Moral Action and Judgment</h1><div class="contributors"><span class="authors"><span role="list"><span property="author" typeof="Person" role="listitem"><a href="#con1"><span property="givenName">Brian</span> <span property="familyName">Ruedinger</span></a> <a class="orcid-id" href="https://orcid.org/0000-0003-1143-4157" property="identifier" aria-label="ORCID identifier" target="_blank" data-id="article-meta-orcid">https://orcid.org/0000-0003-1143-4157</a> <a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#89ebfbe0e8e7fbfcecede0e7eeecfbc9eee4e8e0e5a7eae6e4" property="email" aria-label="Email address"><span class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="e684948f8788949383828f88818394a6818b878f8ac885898b">[email&#160;protected]</span></a></span> and <span property="author" typeof="Person" role="listitem"><a href="#con2"><span property="givenName">Jennifer</span> <span property="familyName">Barnes</span></a></span></span></span><a href="#tab-contributors" class="to-authors-affiliations" data-id="article-meta-viewall-authors">View all authors and affiliations</a></div><div class="core-self-citation"><div class="core-enumeration"><a href="/toc/icaa/41/3"><span property="isPartOf" typeof="PublicationVolume">Volume <span property="volumeNumber">41</span></span>, <span property="isPartOf" typeof="PublicationIssue">Issue <span property="issueNumber">3</span></span></a></div><div class="doi"><a href="https://doi.org/10.1177/02762366211019782" property="sameAs">https://doi.org/10.1177/02762366211019782</a></div></div></div></header><div data-core-nav="header" data-extent="frontmatter"><div class="core-nav-wrapper core-container" aria-label="Article navigation"><div><button data-id="article-toolbar-showhide" aria-controls="article_sections_menu" aria-expanded="false" aria-label="Toggle section navigation menu"><i class="icon-contents" aria-hidden="true"></i><span>Contents</span></button><div id="article_sections_menu" aria-label="Contents" data-core-nav="article"><ul><li><a href="#abstract">Abstract</a></li><li><a href="#bibliography">References</a></li><li><a href="#biographies">Biographies</a></li><li><a href="#supplementary-materials">Supplementary Material</a></li></ul></div></div><div class="collateral-middle"><a href="#core-collateral-purchase-access" data-id="article-nav-menubar-purchaseAccess"><i aria-hidden="true" class="icon-lock-alt"><span class="path1"></span><span class="path2"></span><span class="path3"></span><span class="path4"></span></i><span class="link-text">Get access</span></a></div><div class="collateral-more"><a href="#core-collateral-more" aria-controls="core-collateral-more" aria-disabled="true" disabled="true" data-id="article-toolbar-more"><i aria-hidden="true" class="icon-more"><span class="path1"></span><span class="path2"></span><span class="path3"></span><span class="path4"></span></i><span class="link-text">More</span></a></div><nav id="article_collateral_menu"><ul class="collateral-pill" data-core-nav="collateral"><li><a href="#core-collateral-self-citation" aria-controls="core-collateral-self-citation" aria-disabled="true" disabled="true" data-id="article-nav-menubar-citations"><i aria-hidden="true" class="icon-cite"><span class="path1"></span><span class="path2"></span><span class="path3"></span><span class="path4"></span></i><span class="link-text">Cite</span></a></li><li><a href="#core-collateral-share" aria-controls="core-collateral-share" aria-disabled="true" disabled="true" data-id="article-nav-menubar-share"><i aria-hidden="true" class="icon-share"><span class="path1"></span><span class="path2"></span><span class="path3"></span><span class="path4"></span></i><span class="link-text">Share options</span></a></li><li><a href="#core-collateral-info" aria-controls="core-collateral-info" aria-disabled="true" disabled="true" data-id="article-nav-menubar-info"><i aria-hidden="true" class="icon-info"><span class="path1"></span><span aria-controls="core-collateral-metrics" aria-disabled="true" disabled="true" data-id="article-nav-menubar-metrics"><i aria-hidden="true" class="icon-metrics-alt"><span class="path1"></span><span class="path2"></span><span class="path3"></span><span class="path4"></span></i><span class="link-text">Metrics and citations</span></a></li></ul></nav></div></div><div data-core-wrapper="content"><div id="abstracts" data-extent="frontmatter"><div class="core-container"><section id="abstract" property="abstract" typeof="Text" role="doc-abstract"><h2 property="name">Abstract</h2><div role="paragraph">Research suggests individuals import real-world facts into fictional worlds based on the type of fact and fictional context. We examined the importation of real-world morality across fictional contexts. Undergraduate (Study 1) and MTurk (Study 2) participants were randomly assigned to read either a realistic or matching fantastical interactive narrative. At seven junctions, participants were presented with a choice between behaving morally and behaving immorally to advance their goals. In Study 3, an MTurk sample judged the actions of a character who behaved immorally. For Study 1, a gender by condition interaction was found, with males electing more immoral actions in the fantasy condition. For Study 2, no such effect was found. Nonetheless, in Study 3, participants judged immoral actions in the realistic condition as more immoral compared to the fantasy context. Across all studies, transportation predicted choosing fewer immoral actions and judging immoral actions more harshly.</div></section></div></div><section id="bodymatter" data-extent="bodymatter" property="articleBody" typeof="Text"><div class="core-container"><section aria-labelledby="denial-block-title" class="denial-block "><i class="icon-lock-alt d-lg-none"><span class="path1"></span><span class="path2"></span><span class="path3"></span><span class="path4"></span></i><h2 id="denial-block-title" class="denial-block__title">Get full access to this article</h2><p class="denial-block__text">View all access and purchase options for this article.</p><div class="denial-block__cta"><a href="#core-collateral-purchase-access" class="btn btn-primary"><span>Get Access</span><i aria-hidden="true" class="icon-lock_closed_not_fill"></i></a></div></section></div></section><section id="backmatter" data-extent="backmatter"><div class="core-container"><section id="bibliography" role="doc-bibliography"><h2>References</h2><div role="list"><div role="listitem"><div id="bibr1-02762366211019782" class="citations"><div class="citation"><div class="citation-content">Aquino K., Reed I. I. (2002). In addition to studying the cognitive science of fiction and imagination, she is also a New York Times bestselling novelist. Her research focuses on the impacts of engaging with fiction, the limits of the imagination, and the psychology of fandom.</div></div></section><section id="supplementary-materials" class="core-supplementary-materials"><h2>Supplementary Material</h2><p>Please find the following supplemental material available below.</p><p>For Open Access articles published under a <a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/">Creative Commons License</a>, all supplemental material carries the same license as the article it is associated with.</p><p>For non-Open Access articles published, all supplemental material carries a non-exclusive license, and permission requests for re-use of supplemental material or any part of supplemental material shall be sent directly to the copyright owner as specified in the copyright notice associated with the article.</p><div role="list"><div class="core-supplementary-material" role="listitem"><div class="core-link"><ul><li><a href="/doi/suppl/10.1177/02762366211019782/suppl_file/sj-pdf-1-ica-10.1177_02762366211019782.pdf" download="sj-pdf-1-ica-10.1177_02762366211019782.pdf"><i class="icon-download-outline" aria-hidden="true"></i><span class="core-filename">sj-pdf-1-ica-10.1177_02762366211019782.pdf</span></a></li><li>1.35 MB</li></ul></div></div></div></section></div></section></div><div class="core-collateral" role="dialog" aria-modal="true"><div id="core-collateral-self-citation" aria-expanded="false"><header><h2><i class="icon-cite" aria-hidden="true"></i>Cite</h2></header><h3>Cite</h3><div class="section--wrapper"><section>
